option.description:
Manually set the ratios for each type of Monte Carlo move. This sets the relative probability of choosing a type of Monte Carlo move amongst all of the types of moves available during the simulation, e.g.
mc_weight.solute.intramolecular = 50 mc_weight.solute.rigid_body = 50
mc_weight.solute = 100
mc_weight.protein.backbone = 100 mc_weight.protein.sidechain = 100
mc_weight.protein = 200
mc_weight.solvent = 1000
mc_weight.volume = 500
Set the weight of the types of move that apply only to solute molecule(s).
Set the total weight of all solute moves. Each type of solute move will be assigned an equal sub-weight based on a portion of the total weight.
Set the weight of the intramolecular (bond, angle and dihedral) moves of the solute.
Set the weight of the rigid body (translation and rotation) moves of the solute.
Set the weight of the types of move that apply only to the protein molecule(s).
Set the total weight of all protein moves. Each type of protein move will be assigned an equal sub-weight based on a portion of the total weight.
Set the weight of the backbone moves of residues of the protein.
Set the weight of the sidechain moves of residues of the protein.
Set the weight of the rigid body (translation and rotation) moves of the solvent molecules.
Set the weight of the volume moves. Note that this will be ignored unless you have specified the simulation pressure.
